subject: Self Care
title: The Two-Minute Rule
description: A micro-lesson that makes The Two-Minute Rule usable.

hook.text: Want to read more? The rule says: read one page. Want to run? Put on your shoes. That's the whole habit.

buildup.text: The two-minute rule says any habit should be reduced to a version that takes two minutes or less to do.

discovery.text: The goal is to master showing up. You can't optimize a habit that doesn't exist yet.

twist.text: People think it's too easy. That's the point. Easy means you actually do it. Hard means you don't.

climax.text: Once the two-minute version is automatic, naturally expand. The habit grows itself once the root is planted.

punchline.text: Make it two minutes. The rest follows naturally.

quiz.question: What is the purpose of the two-minute rule?
options: To limit all activities to two minutes
To master the act of showing up before optimizing
To save time on every habit
